title: How to Make Spaghetti Squash Soup

steps.headline: Using a large ripe spaghetti squash, wash it carefully and pierce it with a fork.
Place in a glass pie plate or other glass dish that will fit into your microwave.
Bake on high for 5 minutes and check if it is done (feels very soft to the touch when squeezed all over.
Repeat cooking on high for another 5 minutes if not yet cooked.)
Turn once or twice to facilitate cooking.
Remove from microwave and let rest for 5-10 minutes to cool for ease of handling.
Slice open lengthwise and scoop out seeds and loose inner membranes.
Scoop the strands of squash from the outer shell and place in a large pot.
Add 5-6 cups of vegetable or chicken broth,1 cup grated carrot, 1 cup finely chopped celery, 1/2 cup finely chopped onion, 2 tsp sea salt, 2 tsp.
steps.description: dried parsley, 1 Tbsp. lemon pepper and bring to a boil.

steps.headline: Remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
Using a portable hand mixer puree the mixture until most lumps have dispersed.

text: Prepare the Squash Using a large ripe spaghetti squash, wash it carefully and pierce it with a fork.  Place in a glass pie plate or other glass dish that will fit into your microwave.  Bake on high for 5 minutes and check if it is done (feels very soft to the touch when squeezed all over.  Repeat cooking on high for another 5 minutes if not yet cooked.)  Turn once or twice to facilitate cooking.  Remove from microwave and let rest for 5-10 minutes to cool for ease of handling.  Slice open lengthwise and scoop out seeds and loose inner membranes.  Making the Soup Scoop the strands of squash from the outer shell and place in a large pot.  Add 5-6 cups of vegetable or chicken broth,1 cup grated carrot, 1 cup finely chopped celery, 1/2 cup finely chopped onion, 2 tsp sea salt, 2 tsp. dried parsley, 1 Tbsp. lemon pepper and bring to a boil. Simmer gently for 20-30 minutes.  Remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes.  Using a portable hand mixer puree the mixture until most lumps have dispersed.  Reheat if necessary to serve.  Finished.
